stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses almost the entire session on finishing the Raphael-the-Raven moon boss: fixing a broken hitbox caused by scaling, balancing difficulty, experimenting with cut-scenes, and deciding to spawn the star directly on the moon instead of building a return pipe.  Numerous technical tweaks (quaternions, matrices, camera paths) are made while graphics, animation, VFX and SFX are left for collaborators.  He also outlines hub-world ideas, mentions video editing outsourcing, and states the project is a little over 80 % complete.

development_findings.summary: Raphael the Raven fight now functions but still needs animations, background art, VFX/SFX and camera shakes.
development_findings.quote: We did it, boys. Raphael the Raven is no more. Next step… Zeina is currently working on all the animations; we need VFX, SFX and camera shakes.

development_findings.summary: A scale bug shrank Raven’s hitbox to zero; fixing model scale restored damage detection.
development_findings.quote: The scale of Raphael Raven was too small. He was scaling down so far that his hitbox was 0.

development_findings.summary: Boss grows larger each hit and slows down over time to guarantee eventual victory, a conscious difficulty-balancing choice based on player time, not health.
development_findings.quote: I think we do the pattern-to-increase trick… make it slower the longer the fight goes. That way, everyone is guaranteed to beat it eventually.

development_findings.summary: Star now spawns in world-space above Mario on the moon; the original idea of a return pipe was abandoned due to complex quaternion rotation issues.
development_findings.quote: I think the pipe sucks… I’m just gonna spawn the star on top of the moon. That’s the easiest way to do it.

development_findings.summary: Cut-scene logic uses quaternions and matrix animation: Raven eclipses the moon, changes gravity, and pulls Mario to the new arena.
development_findings.quote: We have the moon… he opens his eyes, jumps, and—voom—he changes the gravity, Mario flies to the moon.

development_findings.summary: Hub world is a Yoshi’s Tropical Island where coins unlock overworld progression objects like bridges or climbable trees.
development_findings.quote: With the coins you can unlock progression in the overworld—pay someone to build a bridge, or a tree you can climb.

development_findings.summary: Overall ROM is ~62 MB only because of streamed music; without it the build would be ~12 MB, showing memory headroom.
development_findings.quote: If I just did non-stream music my ROM would be like 12 MB—a fifth of the size.
What if the game is done? …just over 80 percent.

development_findings.summary: Video editing has been outsourced to a paid editor (Okayo) for future dev-log content.
development_findings.quote: Okayo did. It’s someone I paid to edit the video and hopefully he can edit the next few videos for me.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is mentally stressed (pain level 8) by bureaucratic paperwork, not by development.
context_findings.quote: Rate your current pain… Eight. I’m in mental pain because of bureaucracy.

context_findings.summary: He is frustrated by constant community harassment over release dates; plans to respond with lowercase ‘xd’.
context_findings.quote: You know the most messed-up part about being a famous ROM-maker is when people harass me about the release date… I’m thinking every time someone does that I will just respond with a lowercase xd.

context_findings.summary: Conflicting community feedback on difficulty influences his design philosophy.
context_findings.quote: Comments on YouTube are either ‘this looks way too easy’ or ‘this looks way too hard’. No one ever says ‘Kaze, the difficulty looks perfect’.

context_findings.summary: He intends to make more explanatory videos to earn additional income for his family.
context_findings.quote: I’ve been thinking I should make a lot more videos… I’m gonna make more money for my family.

context_findings.summary: Expresses pride in staying physically fit and links body care to mental care.
context_findings.quote: You gotta take care of your body if you wanna take care of your mind.

biobak.summary: Suggested rotating background and color-shift effects during Raven fight and moon eclipse.
biobak.quote: Biobak, you can make this fight look so cool with the background. Imagine the whole background here just rotating around.

biobak.summary: Proposed visual idea where Raven blocks the moon with his body before the battle.
biobak.quote: Isn’t he supposed to block the moon with his body and make the whole thing go black?

zeina.summary: Created the initial Raven asset; Kaze modified minor aspects for compatibility.
zeina.quote: I think Zeina made it. I just made some small changes to make sure it works better here.

zeina.summary: Currently producing all required boss animations and has delivered a first batch.
zeina.quote: You sent the animations? …Zeina is currently working on all the animations.

key_stories.title: The Vanishing Hitbox
key_stories.summary: While demonstrating the fight Kaze notices Raven no longer takes damage. Investigation reveals that a recent scale change accidentally reduced the hitbox to zero. Restoring proper model scaling fixes the hurtbox entirely.
key_stories.process: Printed Y-positions, inspected scale values, discovered scale mismatch, updated scale constants, retested.
key_stories.outcome: Hitbox restored; Kaze decides Raven should visibly enlarge after each hit for clarity.
key_stories.key_quote: The scale of Raphael Raven was too small… his hitbox was 0.

key_stories.title: Pipe or No Pipe
key_stories.summary: Kaze originally wanted a pipe to appear on the moon to return Mario to the arena, but quaternion math for rotation proved error-prone and visually confusing. After repeated crashes and bad orientations he opts to spawn the Power Star directly above the player instead.
key_stories.challenge: Correctly rotating and positioning a pipe on a spherical surface.
key_stories.process: Tried deriving pitch/yaw from position, experimented with quaternion inversion, debug-printed values, confronted pointer bug, still disliked result.
key_stories.outcome: Design pivot: skip the pipe and have the egg hatch into a star on the moon.
key_stories.key_quote: I think the pipe sucks… I’m just gonna spawn the star on top of the moon.

key_stories.title: Making Difficulty Fair
key_stories.summary: Facing wildly mixed feedback, Kaze chooses a time-based difficulty curve: Raven moves fast at first but progressively slows after each shockwave so every player can eventually land hits.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing a boss that felt either trivial or impossible depending on velocity settings.
key_stories.process: Tested full stops vs constant speed, discussed health-based scaling, coded time-based slowdown via variable ‘bPerm’.
key_stories.outcome: Boss now guarantees eventual victory while keeping early tension.
key_stories.key_quote: Make it slower the longer the fight goes. That way, everyone is guaranteed to beat it eventually.
